The whale watching cruise was upgraded in May 2013 to include watching for dolphins as well, therefore offering an even more enjoyable whale watching tour. At night, one can experience a glamorous night view of Ulsan Industrial Complex while enjoying diverse performances and buffet dining aboard the ship. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330

Course 1 (Dolphin-watching): To Gangdong, Ulgideungdae Lighthouse and back (34 miles / 3 hours)
Course 2 (Dinner Cruise): To Ganjeolgot Cape and back (21 miles / 2 hours)
Course 3 (Dolphin-watching): To Hwaamchu and back (33 miles / 3 hours)| |Facility Utilization Fees:|[Dolphin Watching]

Groups: Adults 15,000 won / Children 7,000 won

[Dinner Cruise]
Adults 50,000 won / Children 30,000 won

* Free admission for children under 3 years of age with accompanying parent.
* If no dolphins are seen during the cruise, passengers may chose one of the following options: free admission to Dolphin Museum, Jangsaengpo Village, or Ulsanham; or a 40% discount on Dolphin ecological experience hall (excluding 4D Theater)
* Adults (ages 13 and older) / Children (ages 3-12)

2F: Restaurant, coffee shop, VIP room, karaoke room
3F: Outdoor terrace, performance stage, snack bar, etc.| |Restrooms:|Available| |Parking Fees:|Charged parking lot (Four hour parking ticket offered to cruise ship passengers)| |Reservation Info. for Foreigners:|[www.whalecity.kr](http://www.whalecity.kr/)| ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-52-226-1900](tel:+82522261900) - [üè†www.whalecity.kr](http://www.whalecity.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 35.5028149271 longitude: 129.3808541361 title: 210, Jangsaengpogorae-ro, Nam-gu, Ulsan ``` ## Directions [Express/Intercity Bus]
Take a bus from Gangnam Express Bus Terminal to Ulsan Express Bus Terminal.

[Bus]

data.title: Jangsaengpo Whale Watching Cruise (Ïû•ÏÉùÌè¨ Í≥†ÎûòÎ∞îÎã§Ïó¨ÌñâÏÑ†)
data.description: Jangsaengpo Whale Cultural District, located in Nam-gu, Ulsan, is famous for the whale-themed tour program featuring a whale watching cruise, a whale museum and the whale ecology familiarization tour. The whale watching cruise was upgraded in May 2013 to include watching for dolphins as well, therefore offering an even more enjoyable whale watching tour. At night, one can experience a glamorous night view of Ulsan Industrial Complex while enjoying diverse performances and buffet dining aboard the ship.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangsaengpo Whale Culture Village (Ïû•ÏÉùÌè¨ Í≥†ÎûòÎ¨∏ÌôîÎßàÏùÑ)
dataList.description: Opened in 2015, Jangsaengpo Whale Culture Village reproduces the scene of an old whaling village through areas like Whale Plaza, Jangsaengpo Old Village, Prehistoric Whale Experience Garden, an aquatic botanical garden and other themed area as well as a sculpture park.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ganwolsan Mountain (Í∞ÑÏõîÏÇ∞)
dataList.description:
Ganwolsan Mountain is a popular destination for hikers in the Ulsan and Busan area as well as other regions of Gyeongsangnam-do. In early August, the reeds and lilies near the summit create a splendid view. To the west, the deep Naerijeong and Wangbonggol Valleys channel clean water to Baenaegol Pass.

From the Ganwolgogae Pass, hikers can follow the Singal Path to Wanbonggol Pass towards Paraeso Falls. There, visitors will find a cave called Jungnimgul, which is sacred Catholic ground often visited by the Catholic faithful. The first church built by Catholics in the Yeongnam region to escape persecution is found in Buldanggol Pass in Ganwolsan Mountain area. The tomb of Kim Agatha who died in persecution is also in the Ganwolgol Valley.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ganwol Recreational Forest (Í∞ÑÏõîÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: The Ganwol Recreational Forest is situated on Ganwolsan Mountain, which is part of the ‚ÄúYeongnam Alps.‚Äù The forest offers various outdoor leisure facilities such as forest bathing paths, training sites, hiking trails, a children‚Äôs play ground, tennis courts, and an observatory. The camping site inside the forest can accommodate up to 700 people, and there are small cooking areas, shower facilities, a sports ground, and various other convenience facilities. The forest is used for corporate training and education, company picnics, student orientations, club picnics, and various other social events.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ganjeolgot Lighthouse (Í∞ÑÏ†àÍ≥∂ Îì±ÎåÄ)
dataList.description: The sunrise along the East Coast can be viewed earliest at Cape Ganjeolgot in Daesong-ri, Uljin-gun. The breathtaking view of the sunrise can be seen a minute earlier than Cape Homigot in Yeongilman Bay and five minutes earlier than Jeongdongjin in Gangneung. Cape Ganjeolgot is in the spotlight as a new tourist attraction along with Jinha Beach and Seosaengpo Japanese Fortress. The lighthouse is located 20 minutes away from the entrance to Ulsan Nambu Beltway. When acacias bloom along the coast from Ulsan to Haeundae Beach in Busan, the road is filled with its subtle perfume. This road is perfect as a driving course with the combination of beautiful white acacia trees in the hills and the occasional appearance of the sea. Enjoy the tremendous scenery of the invigorating sea and the misty view of the hills. Although it is only 20 minutes away from Ulsan Nambu Beltway, the scenic beauty contributes to the exotic look.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Gangdong Pebble Beach (Í∞ïÎèôÎ™ΩÎèåÌï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description: For those hoping for a view of the winter sea, or those longing for the engulfing embrace of the clear dark-blue waves crashing into huge rocks, Gangdong Pebble Beach is the place to be. The coastal road, with its beautiful scenery of the sea and mountains, is a popular driving route. With diverse attractions nearby, many vacationers are attracted to this beach in winter.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Daewangam Park (ÎåÄÏôïÏïîÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Daewangam Park is a seaside park located on the east coast. The park has a walking trail that passes by a forest of pine, cherry blossom trees, magnolias, camellias, apricots, and forsythia. This park is located at the end of the southeasternmost point facing the East Sea, and has a lighthouse that serves as a marker for fisherman and sailors out on the sea. The park is also home to Daewangam Rock that looks like a dragon rising up into the sky. It is connected to the mainland with an iron bridge and has an observation tower.
dataList.author: korea-tour
